name: National Association of Muslim Lawyers
mission: Improving and Enhancing the Legal Profession
zakatClaimEvidence: The search results for the National Association of Muslim Lawyers (NAML) do not explicitly mention that the organization accepts zakat donations. NAML is identified as a 501(c)(6) organization, which is a business league, not a public charity. While NAML has a sister charitable organization, Muslim Advocates (a 501(c)(3)), and partners with the National Muslim Law Students Association (NMLSA) which has a donation page, there is no direct evidence on NAML's own activities or donation pages indicating zakat acceptance. (Source: https://naml.net/donate)

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">working capital reserve of 2.6 months</cite>, providing a baseline of short-term financial stability for its operations.
NAML has a significant track record in the professional space, having been <cite id="3">founded in 2001</cite> and operating for over two decades.

strengths_deep_dive: NAML's primary strength lies in its role as a specialized professional network. It provides <cite id="2">public resource services</cite> and specialized networking platforms that are unique within the American legal landscape. Despite its small financial footprint, the organization has managed to sustain its operations and grow its revenue at a <cite id="1">6.5% compound annual growth rate</cite> over the last three years, indicating a steady, albeit small-scale, demand for its professional services.
rich_narrative.summary: The National Association of Muslim Lawyers (NAML) serves as a professional hub dedicated to <cite id="1">enhancing the legal profession</cite> through networking and community resources. Operating primarily within the United States, the organization focuses on <cite id="2">professional networking, legal community resources</cite>, and public resource services. In the 2023 fiscal year, NAML reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $85,362</cite>, representing a <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 6.5%</cite>. While the organization provides a niche space for Muslim legal professionals, its financial scale remains modest, with <cite id="1">total assets reported at $24,723</cite>. The organization's activities culminate in an <cite id="2">annual conference</cite> designed to foster professional development and community cohesion. However, the charity currently operates with <cite id="3">limited third-party financial verification</cite>, resulting in a low data confidence score. As a professional association, its primary impact is centered on <cite id="2">capacity building</cite> for its members rather than direct humanitarian service delivery.
